text.__SUMMARY__: The large shieldtail snake (Rhinophis saffragamus) is a species of  snake in the family Uropeltidae, which is endemic to the island of Sri Lanka. No subspecies are currently recognized.
text.Geographic range:
It is found in Sri Lanka in central and southern Uva and Sabaragamuwa Provinces. Vertical range is from near sea level to 900 m elevation.
The type locality given is "Philippinschen Inseln": in error, according to M.A. Smith (1943).
text.Taxonomy: It is also mentioned in the synonymy of Ramphotyphlops, a genus of blind snakes, but then as a name proposed by Fitzinger in 1843. However, at the time this name was already preoccupied by Schlegel's Pseudo-typhlops (1839).
